data.title: List of Kings of Aragon (The Once and Never Kings)
data.meta_description: The list of Aragonese rulers is dated from the separation of the then-County of Aragon from the Kingdom of Navarre, as per the will of Sancho III. In 1164, with the dynastic union formed between the Kingdom of Aragon (modern day Lesser Aragon) and the County of Catalonia created the Crown of...
data.text:
The list of Aragonese rulers is dated from the separation of the then-County of Aragon from the Kingdom of Navarre, as per the will of Sancho III. In 1164, with the dynastic union formed between the Kingdom of Aragon (modern day Lesser Aragon) and the County of Catalonia created the Crown of Aragon. Over the next centuries, marriages, inheritance, and conquest would further add to the Aragonese realm.

House of Jim√©nez Monarch Portrait Lifespan Dates of Rule Ramiro I 1007 - 8 May, 1063 (February, 1035 - 8 May, 1063) Sancho Ramirez 1042 - 4 June, 1094 (8 May, 1063 - 4 June, 1094) Peter I 1068 - 28 September, 1104 (4 June, 1094 - 28 September, 1104) Alfonso I 1073 - 8 September, 1134 (28 September, 1104 - 28 September, 1134) Ramiro II 1075 - 16 August, 1157 (28 September, 1134 - 13 November, 1137) Petronilla 29 July, 1136 - 16 October, 1174 (13 November, 1137 - 18 July, 1164)

Petronilla married the Count of Catalonia in 1151. Upon her abdication in 1164, both Aragon and Catalonia passed to their son, Alfonso.

House of Barcelona Monarch Portrait Lifespan Dates of Rule Alfonso II 1157 - 25 April, 1196 (18 July, 1164 - 25 April, 1196) Peter II 1178 - 12 September, 1213 (25 April, 1196 - 12 September, 1213) James I 2 February, 1208 - 27 July, 1276 (12 September, 1213 - 27 July, 1276) Peter III 1240 - 2 November, 1285 (27 July, 1276 - 2 November, 1285) Alfonso III 1265 - 18 June, 1291 (2 November, 1285 - 18 June, 1291) James II 10 August, 1267 - 5 November, 1327 (18 June, 1291 - 5 November, 1327) Alfonso IV 1299 - 27 January, 1336 (5 November, 1327 - 27 January, 1336) Peter IV 5 October, 1319 - 5 January, 1387 (27 January, 1336 - 5 January, 1387) John I 27 December, 1350 - 19 May, 1396 (5 January, 1387 - 19 May, 1396) Martin I 1356 - 31 May, 1410 (19 May, 1396 - 31 May, 1410) Peter V 14 December, 1390 - 11 June, 1447 (31 May, 1410 - 11 June, 1447) James III

the Conqueror 3 March, 1423 - 25 February, 1489 (11 May, 1447 - 25 February, 1489) Martin II 17 July, 1449 - 18 January, 1531 (25 February, 1489 - 18 January, 1531) Alfonso V 9 December, 1481 - 2 April, 1554 (18 January, 1531 - 2 April, 1554) Charles I 23 August, 1515 - 4 July, 1582 (2 April, 1554 - 4 July, 1582) Alfonso VI 14 July, 1548 - 12 September, 1616 (4 July, 1582 - 12 September, 1616) John II 19 February, 1580 - 1 November, 1630 (12 September, 1616 - 1 November, 1630) Charles II 5 March, 1609 - 28 June, 1679 (1 November, 1630 - 28 June, 1679) Peter VI 13 August, 1655 - 12 December, 1732 (28 June, 1679 - 12 December, 1732) James IV 22 October, 1687 - 21 July, 1754 (12 December, 1732 - 21 July, 1754) Isabella 18 March, 1725 - 2 January, 1794 (21 July, 1754 - 3 March, 1759)

Isabella married Archduke Charles of Austria in 1759, bringing the Habsburg dynasty to power in Aragon.

House of Habsburg Monarch Portrait Lifespan Dates of Rule Charles III

the Austrian 14 May, 1721 - 25 March, 1790 (3 March, 1759 - 25 March, 1790)

After Charles' death in 1790, the personal union between Aragon and Austria was broken, and the realms divided between his two sons, Ferdinand taking Aragon, while Leopold took Austria-Bohemia.

House of Barcelona-Habsburg Monarch Portrait Lifespan Dates of Rule Ferdinand I 2 April, 1765 - 22 June, 1831 (25 March, 1790 - 22 June, 1831) Charles IV 18 January, 1799 - 5 April, 1857 (22 June, 1831 - 5 April, 1857) Charles V 29 September, 1829 - 4 May, 1878 (5 April, 1857 - 13 August, 1857)

Charles V was forced to flee Aragon after the fall of Zaragoza and the conquest of Aragon and Castile. Nevertheless, he continued to expertly command Aragon's exiled army and navy. Meanwhile, Aragon was incorporated into Napoleone Buonaparte's "Kingdom of Spain".

House of Bounaparte Monarch Portrait Lifespan Dates of Rule Napoleone 20 April, 1818 - 9 January, 1883 (13 August, 1857 - 14 September, 1865)

After the collapse of Napoleone's empire, Aragon was restored to its pre-Napoleonic Wars territory.
